data.event: Incorporated in 1763, the town takes its name from Croydon, a suburb of London, England.. Croydon was home to Ruel Durkee, a powerful 19th century political boss in the state.
The town of "Coniston" in the best-selling novel of 1906 is based on Croydon, and Durkee was portrayed as "Jethro Bass".
